Package src.main.persistence.controllers

Class XMLController

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.main.persistence.controllers.FileController
      • src.main.persistence.controllers.XMLController
  • public class XMLController
extends FileController
    This class represents the Controller in charge of the downloading and uploading the .xml files.

      • downloadDocument

        public void downloadDocument​(java.lang.String extension,
                             java.lang.String path,
                             java.lang.String title,
                             java.lang.String author,
                             java.lang.String content,
                             boolean ow)
                      throws FileAlreadyExists,
                             ForbiddenExtension
        To download documents from the running program into XML format In order for it to work, the extension must be XML and the overwritting permission can be set. Normally will be 0, but can be 1 if the user gives permission to overwrite a file (in the case that there exists a file in the same folder with same name and extension). This is the XML extension downloader.
        Overrides:
        downloadDocument in class FileController
        Parameters:
        extension - format of the document
        content - Content of the Document to be saved.
        path - Path where the file will be saved.
        title - Title of the Document to be saved.
        author - Author of the Document to be saved.
        ow - Permission bit with value 0 if overwrite can't be done, 1 otherwise.
        Throws:
        FileAlreadyExists - If the file already exists, then this exception is thrown in order to avoid deleting it without. asking the user.
        ForbiddenExtension - If the file extension chosen is not supported then. this exception is thrown to stop the execution.

      • uploadDocument

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> uploadDocument​(java.lang.String extension,
                                                            java.lang.String path,
                                                            boolean ow)
                                                     throws ForbiddenExtension,
                                                            UnrecognisableFormatting,
                                                            FileDoesntExists
        Checks if the file on path, can be uploaded (even if it overwrites another document), considering that the extension type must be supported and the format must be correct.
        Overrides:
        uploadDocument in class FileController
        Parameters:
        extension - File extension of the uploaded file.
        path - Path where the file to be uploaded is located.
        ow - permission bit with value 0 if overwrite can't be done, 1 otherwise.
        Throws:
        ForbiddenExtension - If the extension of the file uploaded is not one of the allowed ones.
        UnrecognisableFormatting
        FileDoesntExists
